transcript:
When will this pain end?
I feel like fear has stolen my courage. It strikes me with its power,
But I must overcome, I must overcome, I have to overcome. The battle without my thoughts, I don't lie to you 
I don’t have the strength to go on, but I won’t give up! In the desert I am growing Despite what I’m living through, I keep learning What it means to have patience.
I’m building my endurance. In the desert, I’ll leave my footprints.
I’ll leave my footprints, I’ll leave my footprints. In the desert, I’ll leave my footprints.
I’ll leave my footprints, I’ll leave my footprints, In the desert  I have to win the war against anxiety I’ve got one life, and I’m going to fight for it.
Like a lion roaring in the darkness, I will overcome! I will overcome!
Free me from panic and insomnia. Renew my mind, rebuke guilt and my demons.
It’s one day at a time, without losing faith. What I don’t understand now, I’ll understand later. I’m creating new habits with sacrifice,
Leaving behind vices, And giving hard to exercise
The vultures will not eat my leftovers. The enemy is stunned because I’m a warrior in the shadows. The wind whispers words of fear to me,
But I resist; I’ll win the battle within. No child of God loses the war against depression—I won’t! In the desert, I keep growing.
Despite what I’m living through, I keep learning What it means to have patience.
I’m building my endurance. In the desert, I will leave my footprints I will leave my footprints, I will leave my footprints In the desert, I will leave my footprints I will leave my footprints footprints, I will leave my footprints, In the desert 
Lonely place A place of change,
A place of affliction, of transformation. A place of thirst,
A place of faith, A place of experience, of resilience.
A place for the weak, A place for the strong,
A place of life, A place of death.
When I faced what I feared, I realized I wasn’t as weak as I thought.
Lord! Make me see that You’re always there. Clear up my confusion and bring me back to You.
Help me believe in Your Word, not in my emotions. You gave me power to trample serpents and scorpions. Self-control governs my feelings.
I keep renewing myself through suffering. I feel like You’re making me new—yes!
